intro: Dissotis verticillata, commonly known as the whorled spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in whorls around the stem, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
